page.title: 09RELIGION MORLEY & DEOPHAM
page.content: Morley St. Botolph church has a square tower facing west, with a large round clockface on it, and containing three bells. In 1880 the church was rebuilt on the original foundtions. In 1950 a fierce fire destroyed the roof and pews. Today the church is very modernly furnished, with a beautifully chequered floor. The square tower of Deopham church is 100 feet tall and stands out as a landmark. It has set back buttresses joined diagonally across the corners. About 18 feet above ground level is a band of external decoration adorned with flowers and fruit. Paintings were discovered on the interior walls during restoration work.The tower has a ring of 5 bells.
